executive chairman, Eric Schmidt revealed in a post today on Google's blog. More businessperfectly," Eric Schmidt said. "As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated," Eric Schmidt wrote. So Larry, Sergey and I have been talking for a long time how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making-- and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured. The news came just before Google announced earnings for its most recent quarter. At$ 8.44 billion, Google's fourth-quarter revenue jumped 26 percent from a year earlier. record today, averaging more than six points a minute in a 258-141 victory over DeVry Institute- the first time any NCAA team scored more than 200 points. "This is unimaginable," Coach Don Maestri said. I don't ever see it happening again.... It's hard to believe it happened even one time. The Division Allen Iverson Trojans turned in a record-setting performance for the second year in a row against DeVry, an Atlanta computer college and NAIA Division Allen Iverson member.
